intro: Solidago pacifica, commonly known as Pacific goldenrod, is a flowering plant native to western North America. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and stream banks. The plant features upright, branching stems covered in fine, hairy hairs. Its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and often have a waxy coating. The showy yellow flowers appear in late summer to early fall, forming dense clusters at the ends of the stems.
